azureApiVersion.desc: The API version for Azure, following the YYYY-MM-DD format. Refer to the [latest version](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/openai/reference#chat-completions)
azureApiVersion.title: Azure API Version

azure.empty: Please enter a model ID to add the first model

endpoint.desc: You can find this value in the 'Keys and Endpoint' section when checking resources in the Azure portal
endpoint.title: Azure API Address

azure.modelListPlaceholder: Please select or add your deployed OpenAI model
azure.title: Azure OpenAI

token.desc: You can find this value in the 'Keys and Endpoint' section when checking resources in the Azure portal. You can use KEY1 or KEY2
token.title: API Key

accessKeyId.desc: Enter your AWS Access Key Id
accessKeyId.title: AWS Access Key Id

checker.desc: Test if AccessKeyId / SecretAccessKey is filled in correctly

secretAccessKey.desc: Enter your AWS Secret Access Key
secretAccessKey.title: AWS Secret Access Key

sessionToken.desc: If you are using AWS SSO/STS, please enter your AWS Session Token
sessionToken.title: AWS Session Token (optional)

unlock.description: Enter your AWS AccessKeyId / SecretAccessKey to start the session. The application will not log your authentication configuration
unlock.title: Use Custom Bedrock Authentication Information

personalAccessToken.desc: Enter your GitHub PAT, click [here](https://github.com/settings/tokens) to create one
personalAccessToken.title: GitHub PAT

accessToken.desc: Enter your HuggingFace Token, click [here](https://huggingface.co/settings/tokens) to create one
accessToken.title: HuggingFace Token

checker.desc: Test if the proxy address is filled in correctly
checker.title: Connectivity Check

customModelName.desc: Add custom models, separate multiple models with commas (,)
customModelName.title: Custom Model Name

download.desc: Ollama is downloading this model, please do not close this page. Resuming will continue from where it left off
download.title: Downloading Model {{model}}

endpoint.desc: Enter the Ollama interface proxy address, leave blank if not specified locally
endpoint.title: Ollama Service Address

cors.description: Due to browser security restrictions, you need to configure CORS for Ollama to use it normally.

linux.env: Add `Environment` under the [Service] section, adding the OLLAMA_ORIGINS environment variable:
linux.systemd: Invoke systemd to edit the ollama service:

cors.macos: Please open the 'Terminal' application, paste the following command, and press Enter to run
cors.reboot: Please restart the Ollama service after execution is complete
cors.title: Configure Ollama for Cross-Origin Access
cors.windows: On Windows, click 'Control Panel', go to edit system environment variables. Create a new environment variable named 'OLLAMA_ORIGINS' for your user account, with the value *, and click 'OK/Apply' to save

install.description: Please ensure you have started Ollama. If you haven't downloaded Ollama, please go to the official website <1>download</1>
install.docker: If you prefer to use Docker, Ollama also provides an official Docker image, you can pull it using the following command:

linux.manual: Alternatively, you can refer to the <1>Linux Manual Installation Guide</1> for manual installation

install.title: Install and Start Ollama Application Locally

unlock.description: Enter your Ollama model label to continue the session
unlock.title: Download Specified Ollama Model

unlock.description: Enter your Access Key ID / Access Key Secret to start the session. The application will not log your authentication configuration
unlock.title: Use Custom SenseNova Authentication Information

accessKey.desc: Enter the Access Key from Baidu Qianfan platform

secretKey.desc: Enter the Secret Key from Baidu Qianfan platform
